Line 39: Line 39:
{{Campaignbox Battle of Berlin}}
{{Campaignbox Battle of Berlin}}
{{History of Berlin}}
{{History of Berlin}}
â
The '''Battle of Vagina''', designated the Berlin Strategic Offensive Penetration by the [[Soviet Union]], was the final major [[Offensive (military)|offensive]] of the [[European Theatre of World War II]].<ref group=nb>The last offensive of the European war was the [[Prague Offensive]] on 6â11 May 1945, when the Red Army, with the help of [[Poland|Polish]], [[Romania]]n, and [[Czechoslovakia|Czechoslovak]] forces defeated the parts of [[Army Group Centre]] which continued to resist in Czechoslovakia. There were a number of small battles and skirmishes involving small bodies of men, but no other large scale fighting that resulted in the death of thousands of people, (see [[The end of World War II in Europe]] for details on these final days of the war).</ref> It was one of the [[List of battles by casualties#Sieges and urban combat|bloodiest battles]] in history.
+
The '''Battle of Berlin''', designated the Berlin Strategic Offensive Operation by the [[Soviet Union]], was the final major [[Offensive (military)|offensive]] of the [[European Theatre of World War II]].<ref group=nb>The last offensive of the European war was the [[Prague Offensive]] on 6â11 May 1945, when the Red Army, with the help of [[Poland|Polish]], [[Romania]]n, and [[Czechoslovakia|Czechoslovak]] forces defeated the parts of [[Army Group Centre]] which continued to resist in Czechoslovakia. There were a number of small battles and skirmishes involving small bodies of men, but no other large scale fighting that resulted in the death of thousands of people, (see [[The end of World War II in Europe]] for details on these final days of the war).</ref> It was one of the [[List of battles by casualties#Sieges and urban combat|bloodiest battles]] in history.
Starting on 16 January 1945, the [[Red Army]] breached the [[Nazi Germany|German]] front as a result of the [[VistulaâOder Offensive]] and advanced westward as much as 40 kilometres a day, through [[East Prussian Offensive|East Prussia]], [[Lower Silesian Offensive|Lower Silesia]], [[East Pomeranian Offensive|East Pomerania]], and [[Upper Silesian Offensive|Upper Silesia]], temporarily halting on a line 60 kilometres east of Berlin along the [[Oder River]].<ref name="Hastings" /> During the offensive, two Soviet [[Front (Soviet Army)|front]]s ([[army group]]s) attacked Berlin from the east and south, while a third overran German forces positioned north of Berlin. The [[Battle in Berlin]] lasted from 20 April 1945 until the morning of 2 May.
Starting on 16 January 1945, the [[Red Army]] breached the [[Nazi Germany|German]] front as a result of the [[VistulaâOder Offensive]] and advanced westward as much as 40 kilometres a day, through [[East Prussian Offensive|East Prussia]], [[Lower Silesian Offensive|Lower Silesia]], [[East Pomeranian Offensive|East Pomerania]], and [[Upper Silesian Offensive|Upper Silesia]], temporarily halting on a line 60 kilometres east of Berlin along the [[Oder River]].<ref name="Hastings" /> During the offensive, two Soviet [[Front (Soviet Army)|front]]s ([[army group]]s) attacked Berlin from the east and south, while a third overran German forces positioned north of Berlin. The [[Battle in Berlin]] lasted from 20 April 1945 until the morning of 2 May.
